column5: Hello everybody, just wanted to introduce myself as I've been lurking here quite a bit. I'm from Ohio and have been on 6 or 7 fly ins with a couple drive ins as well. I've also did the Boundary Waters and while unique and beautiful, you can keep the canoes. I'm in the middle or hopefully the end of picking this years trip and may have a few questions. Seems like a lot of places have filled their cabins, economy must be on the up turn. Thanks, Bill
Hi Bill, welcome to the board!

You're going to find some good people here, that share our Love of Ontario. Sounds like your planning a spring trip, May and June can fill up quickly! If you can go later in the summer, you can find open cabins. Good luck!
Welcome..........There is a lot of good information on this site, members will go out of their way to make your next trip memorable.
Welcome fellow Buckeye! Ask away, I'm sure you'll get plenty of responses

Hi Bill and welcome to the boards. As a relative newbie and especially a novice fisherman, I can certainly confirm the previous posts regarding how generous the posters on this site are. I can't imagine how I'd have made some of the recent decisions I've faced including camps, boats and electronics without the incredible generosity of posters on this site. I look forward to reading your future posts.

Bayou,Welcome to Walleye Central.....great site for excellent fishing information,laughs, Canadian fishing lodges, laughs, boats, motors and fishing equipment, laughs....well, you get the idea.Am glad to have another Buckeye on board.....there's lots of good folks here from our northern states (MN, Wisconsin, MI, SD & ND, etc) as well as from north of the border, and a few on the coasts as well as overseas; so no lack of excellent information available to you (whatever the topic - well, most days anyway and worth every cent you paid for it - ha).You'll enjoy visiting this site....it can become addictive though....GO BUCKS,Rich B
Thanks everyone for the warm welcome
